title: USS Rogers Blood (DE-555)
text:
USS "Rogers Blood" (DE-555) was a proposed <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> <a href="United%20States%20Navy">United States Navy</a> <a href="John%20C.%20Butler%20class%20destroyer%20escort">"John C. Butler"-class</a> <a href="destroyer%20escort">destroyer escort</a> that was never completed.
Plans called for "Rogers Blood" to be built at the <a href="Boston%20Navy%20Yard">Boston Navy Yard</a> at <a href="Boston">Boston</a>, <a href="Massachusetts">Massachusetts</a>. The <a href="contract">contract</a> for her construction was cancelled in 1944.
The name "Rogers Blood" was reassigned to the destroyer escort USS "Rogers Blood" (DE-605), which was converted during construction into the <a href="fast%20transport">fast transport</a> <a href="USS%20Rogers%20Blood%20%28APD-115%29">USS "Rogers Blood" (APD-115)</a> and was in <a href="Ship%20commissioning">commission</a> as such from 1945 to 1946.
